t: Isaiah 3
Judgment on Judah and Jerusalem
For*pn behold, the Lord God*s of hosts is*ld taking away from Jerusalem and from Judah support*ln and supply, all*ld support of bread, and*ld all support of water;
the*ln mighty man and the soldier, the*ld judge and the prophet, the*ld diviner and the elder,
the*ln captain of fifty and*ld the man of rank, the*ln counselor and the skillful magician and*ld the expert in charms.
And*ln I will make boys their princes, and*ld infants shall rule over them.
And*ln the people will oppress one another, every*ld one his fellow and*ld every one his neighbor; the*ln youth will be insolent to the elder, and*ld the despised to the honorable.
For*pn a man will take hold of his brother in*ld the house of his father, saying: “You*ln have a cloak; you*ld shall be our leader, and*ln this heap of ruins shall*ld be under your rule”;
in*ln that day he will speak out, saying: “I*ln will not be a healer; in*ld my house there is neither bread nor cloak; you*ln shall not make me leader*ld of the people.”
For*ln Jerusalem has stumbled, and*ld Judah has fallen, because*ln their speech and their deeds are against the Lord,*s defying*ld his glorious presence.
For*pn the look on their faces bears witness against them; they*ld proclaim their sin like Sodom; they*ld do not hide it. Woe*ln to them! For*ld they have brought evil on themselves.
Tell*ln the righteous that it shall be well with them, for*ld they shall eat the fruit of their deeds.
Woe*ln to the wicked! It shall be ill with him, for*ld what his hands have dealt out shall be done to him.
My*ln people— infants are their oppressors, and*ld women rule over them. O*ln my people, your guides mislead you and*ld they have swallowed up the course of your paths.
The*pn Lord*s has taken his place to contend; he*ld stands to judge peoples.
The*ln Lord*s will enter into judgment with*ld the elders and princes of his people: “It*ln is you who have devoured the vineyard, the*ld spoil of the poor is in your houses.
What*ln do you mean by crushing my people, by*ld grinding the face of the poor?” declares*l the Lord God*s of hosts.
The*pn Lord*s said: Because*ln the daughters of Zion are haughty and*ld walk with outstretched necks, glancing*ld wantonly with their eyes, mincing*ln along as they go, tinkling*ld with their feet,
therefore*ln the Lord will strike with a scab the*ld heads of the daughters of Zion, and*ld the Lord*s will lay bare their secret parts.
In*p that day the Lord will take away the finery of the anklets, the headbands, and the crescents;
the pendants, the bracelets, and the scarves;
the headdresses, the armlets, the sashes, the perfume boxes, and the amulets;
the signet rings and nose rings;
the festal robes, the mantles, the cloaks, and the handbags;
the mirrors, the linen garments, the turbans, and the veils.

Instead*pn of perfume there will be rottenness; and*ld instead of a belt, a rope; and*ln instead of well-set hair, baldness; and*ld instead of a rich robe, a skirt of sackcloth; and*ld branding instead of beauty.
Your*ln men shall fall by the sword and*ld your mighty men in battle.
And*ln her gates shall lament and mourn; empty,*ld she shall sit on the ground.
